person.persName: Samuel Howard Ford (McCracken County, KY, Baptist minister, editor, politician, provisional Congress (Confederate))

body.p: McCracken County, Kentucky, Baptist minister, editor, politician. Native of England. Married to Sallie Rochester Ford. Father of Samuel Ford. Graduated from Missouri State University in 1843 and ordained a Baptist minister. Minister in the Missouri cities of Jefferson City, St. Louis, and Cape Girardeau from 1844 to 1847. Co-editor of the Western Recorder with Dr. John L. Waller. Co-editor and, following Waller’s death, editor of Christian Repository. Minister of the Gum Spring Baptist Church in McCracken County, Kentucky of the West Union Association in 1852. Minister of the East Baptist Church, Long Run Baptist Church, and Floyds Fork Baptist Church in Louisville, Kentucky of the Long Run Association from 1853 to 1861. Minister in Memphis, Tennessee in 1861. Served as a member of the Provisional Congress of the Confederate States from 1861 to 1862. Minister in Mobile, Alabama from 1863 to 1865. Returned to Memphis as a minister in 1865.
